title: Fife Coastal Path St Andrews To Leuchars Walking Route

images.title: James Allan / View of Shelly Point
images.caption: View of Shelly Point. In the distance is Shelly Point headland, close to which is the radar tower of RAF Leuchars. Seen here from the south side of the river Eden.

images.title: Jim Bain / Towards the Eden
images.caption: Towards the Eden View from the old road northwards out across the Eden. Much of the area down by the shore is the site of an old brickworks.

images.title: Gordon Brown / River Eden estuary at Guardbridge
images.caption: River Eden estuary at Guardbridge. The village takes its name from the 15th-century six-arched bridge built by Bishop Henry Wardlaw who founded the University of St Andrews

images.title: Station Road, Leuchars by Nigel Thompson, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Station Road, Leuchars

description: This walk follows a section of the Fife Coastal Path from St Andrews To Leuchars. The route runs for just over 6 miles, following a flat path that can also be used for cycling. Starting on the coast at St Andrews you head north west, passing the famous golf course where The Open has been played many times. You then continue along the lovely Eden Estuary where you can see a wide variety of wading birds. At Guardbridge you cross the River Eden on an ancient bridge, passing the Bird Observatory and the Paper Mill. The final section crosses Motray Water before finishing in Leuchars. You can extend the walk on the Tayport To Tentsmuir Walk which will take you through the splendid Tentsmuir Forest with its red squirrels and roe deer. You can also visit the wildlife rich Morton Lochs here as well. In the other direction there's the popular St Andrews to Anstruther Coastal Walk which visits the historic village of Crail.
display_address: Shorehead, St Andrews, Fife, Alba / Scotland, KY16 9RG, United Kingdom
